function.name: c4c_create_lead_39
function.description: Create a new lead in SAP C4C. Returns: Object with ObjectID (auto-generated ID), Name, StatusCode, QualificationLevelCode, AccountPartyID, ContactFirstName, ContactLastName, Company, OriginTypeCode, and all other lead fields

account_party_id.description: SAP C4C account party ID (if linking to existing account)

qualification_level_code.description: Lead qualification level (e.g., "01", "02", "03", "04"). When set, StatusCode automatically becomes "Qualified"

origin_type_code.description: Lead source/origin code (e.g., "1" for direct contact)

additional_fields.description: JSON object with additional SAP C4C lead fields (for custom fields or other standard fields not listed above)

function.name: c4c_get_lead_39
function.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific lead by its ObjectID. Returns: Object with ObjectID, Name, StatusCode, QualificationLevelCode, AccountPartyID, ContactFirstName, ContactLastName, Company, OriginTypeCode, GroupCode, OwnerPartyID, CreatedOn, ChangedOn, and all other lead fields

function.name: c4c_search_leads_39
function.description: Search leads using OData filter syntax. Returns: Object with leads array, count, pagination metadata (has_more, next_skip). Example filters: "StatusCode eq '2'" (status equals 2), "Company eq 'ACME Corp'" (company equals ACME Corp), "QualificationLevelCode eq '03'" (qualification level 03)

filter.description: OData $filter query (e.g., "StatusCode eq '2'", "Company eq 'ACME Corp'"). Use single quotes for string values. Supports: eq (equals), ne (not equals), gt (greater than), lt (less than), and (logical AND), or (logical OR). Leave empty to retrieve all leads.

top.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 50, max: 1000)

skip.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)

orderby.description: OData $orderby clause for sorting (e.g., "Name asc", "CreatedOn desc")

function.name: c4c_update_lead_39
function.description: Update an existing lead's fields. Returns: Updated lead object with ObjectID and all modified fields. Note: You can only update fields that have sap:updatable="true" in the SAP C4C metadata.

status_code.description: New status code (e.g., "2" for qualified, "3" for converted)

additional_fields.description: JSON object with additional SAP C4C lead fields to update (for custom fields or other standard fields not listed above)

function.name: c4c_list_leads_39
function.description: Get a paginated list of all leads without filters. Simpler than search for browsing leads. Returns: Object with leads array, count, pagination metadata (has_more, next_skip)

top.description: Maximum number of results per page (default: 50, max: 1000)

skip.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0). Use next_skip from previous response.

function.name: c4c_create_opportunity_39
function.description: Create a new sales opportunity in SAP C4C. IMPORTANT: For tenant-specific fields (sales phase, closing date, status), first call c4c_get_entity_metadata("Opportunity") to discover correct field names, then pass them via additional_fields. Returns: Object with ObjectID and all opportunity fields.

account_party_id.description: SAP C4C AccountID (short numeric like "10025480" from the AccountID field in search results, NOT the 32-char ObjectID) to link this opportunity to

main_contact_party_id.description: SAP C4C ContactID (short numeric like "10025484" from the ContactID field in search results, NOT the 32-char ObjectID) for primary contact

additional_fields.description: JSON object with SAP C4C field names from metadata. Use c4c_get_entity_metadata to discover correct field names. IMPORTANT: Date fields MUST use ISO 8601 format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss" (e.g., "2026-03-03T00:00:00"), NOT "YYYY-MM-DD". Examples: SalesCyclePhaseCode for sales phase, ExpectedProcessingEndDate for closing date.

function.name: c4c_get_opportunity_39
function.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific opportunity by its ObjectID. Returns: Object with ObjectID, Name, AccountPartyID, MainContactPartyID, ExpectedRevenueAmount, SalesPhaseCode, StatusCode, ProbabilityPercent, ExpectedClosingDate, and all other opportunity fields. Use expand to include related collections.

expand.description: Comma-separated navigation properties to expand (e.g., "OpportunityParty,OpportunityItem"). Common: OpportunityParty (all parties), OpportunityProspectPartyContactParty (prospect contacts), OpportunitySalesTeamParty (sales team), OpportunityItem (line items), OpportunityTextCollection (notes)

function.name: c4c_search_opportunities_39
function.description: Search opportunities using OData filter syntax. Returns: Object with opportunities array, count, pagination metadata. Example filters: "StatusCode eq '2'", "AccountPartyID eq 'XXX'". Use expand to include related collections.

filter.description: OData $filter query. Use single quotes for string values. Supports: eq, ne, gt, lt, and, or. Leave empty to retrieve all opportunities.

skip.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)

expand.description: Comma-separated navigation properties to expand (e.g., "OpportunityParty,OpportunityItem"). Common: OpportunityParty, OpportunityProspectPartyContactParty, OpportunitySalesTeamParty, OpportunityItem, OpportunityTextCollection

function.name: c4c_update_opportunity_39
function.description: Update an existing opportunity's fields. IMPORTANT: For tenant-specific fields (sales phase, status), first call c4c_get_entity_metadata("Opportunity") to discover correct field names, then pass them via additional_fields. Returns: Updated opportunity object.

account_party_id.description: New AccountID to link (short numeric like "10025480" from AccountID field, NOT 32-char ObjectID)

main_contact_party_id.description: New ContactID (short numeric like "10025484" from ContactID field, NOT 32-char ObjectID)

additional_fields.description: JSON object with SAP C4C field names from metadata. Use c4c_get_entity_metadata to discover correct field names. IMPORTANT: Date fields MUST use ISO 8601 format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss" (e.g., "2026-03-03T00:00:00"), NOT "YYYY-MM-DD". Examples: SalesCyclePhaseCode for sales phase, LifeCycleStatusCode for status.

function.name: c4c_list_opportunities_39
function.description: Get a paginated list of all opportunities without filters. Returns: Object with opportunities array, count, pagination metadata. Use expand to include related collections.

expand.description: Comma-separated navigation properties to expand (e.g., "OpportunityParty,OpportunityItem"). Common: OpportunityParty, OpportunityProspectPartyContactParty, OpportunitySalesTeamParty, OpportunityItem, OpportunityTextCollection

function.name: c4c_search_accounts_39

skip.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)

expand_contacts.description: Include linked contacts in response (default: false)

function.name: c4c_list_accounts_39

function.name: c4c_get_entity_metadata_39
function.description: IMPORTANT: Call this BEFORE using search/filter tools if you are unsure about property names. Fetches OData metadata for any SAP C4C entity to discover available properties, their types, and which ones can be used in $filter queries. Returns: filterable_properties (array of property names safe to use in filters), creatable_properties, updatable_properties, and all_properties with full details including type and nullability.

entity_type.description: Entity type name: "Opportunity", "Lead", "CorporateAccount", "Contact". Use exact names without "Collection" suffix.
